trans-unit.source: Draws formatted text in the specified rectangle

seg-source.mrk: Draws formatted text in the specified rectangle

target.mrk: Draws formatted text in the specified rectangle

trans-unit.source: Parameters

seg-source.mrk: Parameters

target.mrk: Parameters

trans-unit.source: Identifies the device context

seg-source.mrk: Identifies the device context

target.mrk: Identifies the device context

trans-unit.source: The string to be drawn

seg-source.mrk: The string to be drawn

target.mrk: The string to be drawn

trans-unit.source: $tagRECT structure that contains the rectangle for the text

seg-source.mrk: $tagRECT structure that contains the rectangle for the text

target.mrk: $tagRECT structure that contains the rectangle for the text

trans-unit.source: Specifies the method of formatting the text:

seg-source.mrk: Specifies the method of formatting the text:

target.mrk: Specifies the method of formatting the text:

trans-unit.source: $DT_BOTTOM - Justifies the text to the bottom of the rectangle

seg-source.mrk: $DT_BOTTOM - Justifies the text to the bottom of the rectangle

target.mrk: $DT_BOTTOM - Justifies the text to the bottom of the rectangle

trans-unit.source: $DT_CALCRECT - Determines the width and height of the rectangle

seg-source.mrk: $DT_CALCRECT - Determines the width and height of the rectangle

target.mrk: $DT_CALCRECT - Determines the width and height of the rectangle

trans-unit.source: $DT_CENTER - Centers text horizontally in the rectangle

seg-source.mrk: $DT_CENTER - Centers text horizontally in the rectangle

target.mrk: $DT_CENTER - Centers text horizontally in the rectangle

trans-unit.source: $DT_EDITCONTROL - Duplicates the text-displaying characteristics of a multiline edit control

seg-source.mrk: $DT_EDITCONTROL - Duplicates the text-displaying characteristics of a multiline edit control

target.mrk: $DT_EDITCONTROL - Duplicates the text-displaying characteristics of a multiline edit control

trans-unit.source: $DT_END_ELLIPSIS - Replaces part of the given string with ellipses if necessary

seg-source.mrk: $DT_END_ELLIPSIS - Replaces part of the given string with ellipses if necessary

target.mrk: $DT_END_ELLIPSIS - Replaces part of the given string with ellipses if necessary

trans-unit.source: $DT_EXPANDTABS - Expands tab characters

seg-source.mrk: $DT_EXPANDTABS - Expands tab characters

target.mrk: $DT_EXPANDTABS - Expands tab characters

trans-unit.source: $DT_EXTERNALLEADING - Includes the font external leading in line height

seg-source.mrk: $DT_EXTERNALLEADING - Includes the font external leading in line height

target.mrk: $DT_EXTERNALLEADING - Includes the font external leading in line height

trans-unit.source: $DT_HIDEPREFIX - Ignores the ampersand (&) prefix character in the text.

seg-source.mrk: $DT_HIDEPREFIX - Ignores the ampersand (&) prefix character in the text.

target.mrk: $DT_HIDEPREFIX - Ignores the ampersand (&) prefix character in the text.

trans-unit.source: The letter that follows will not be underlined, but other mnemonic-prefix characters are still processed.

seg-source.mrk: The letter that follows will not be underlined, but other mnemonic-prefix characters are still processed.

target.mrk: The letter that follows will not be underlined, but other mnemonic-prefix characters are still processed.

trans-unit.source: $DT_INTERNAL - Uses the system font to calculate text metrics

seg-source.mrk: $DT_INTERNAL - Uses the system font to calculate text metrics

target.mrk: $DT_INTERNAL - Uses the system font to calculate text metrics

trans-unit.source: $DT_LEFT - Aligns text to the left

seg-source.mrk: $DT_LEFT - Aligns text to the left

target.mrk: $DT_LEFT - Aligns text to the left

trans-unit.source: $DT_MODIFYSTRING - Modifies the given string to match the displayed text

seg-source.mrk: $DT_MODIFYSTRING - Modifies the given string to match the displayed text

target.mrk: $DT_MODIFYSTRING - Modifies the given string to match the displayed text

trans-unit.source: $DT_NOCLIP - Draws without clipping

seg-source.mrk: $DT_NOCLIP - Draws without clipping

target.mrk: $DT_NOCLIP - Draws without clipping

trans-unit.source: $DT_NOFULLWIDTHCHARBREAK - Prevents a line break at a DBCS (double-wide character string), so that the line breaking rule is equivalent to SBCS strings.

seg-source.mrk: $DT_NOFULLWIDTHCHARBREAK - Prevents a line break at a DBCS (double-wide character string), so that the line breaking rule is equivalent to SBCS strings.

target.mrk: $DT_NOFULLWIDTHCHARBREAK - Prevents a line break at a DBCS (double-wide character string), so that the line breaking rule is equivalent to SBCS strings.

trans-unit.source: For example, this can be used in Korean windows, for more readability of icon labels.

seg-source.mrk: For example, this can be used in Korean windows, for more readability of icon labels.

target.mrk: For example, this can be used in Korean windows, for more readability of icon labels.

trans-unit.source: This value has no effect unless $DT_WORDBREAK is specified

seg-source.mrk: This value has no effect unless $DT_WORDBREAK is specified

target.mrk: This value has no effect unless $DT_WORDBREAK is specified

trans-unit.source: $DT_NOPREFIX - Turns off processing of prefix characters

seg-source.mrk: $DT_NOPREFIX - Turns off processing of prefix characters

target.mrk: $DT_NOPREFIX - Turns off processing of prefix characters

trans-unit.source: $DT_PATH_ELLIPSIS - For displayed text, replaces characters in the middle of the string with ellipses so that the result fits in the specified rectangle.

seg-source.mrk: $DT_PATH_ELLIPSIS - For displayed text, replaces characters in the middle of the string with ellipses so that the result fits in the specified rectangle.

target.mrk: $DT_PATH_ELLIPSIS - For displayed text, replaces characters in the middle of the string with ellipses so that the result fits in the specified rectangle.

trans-unit.source: If the string contains backslash (\) characters, $DT_PATH_ELLIPSIS preserves as much as possible of the text after the last backslash.

seg-source.mrk: If the string contains backslash (\) characters, $DT_PATH_ELLIPSIS preserves as much as possible of the text after the last backslash.

target.mrk: If the string contains backslash (\) characters, $DT_PATH_ELLIPSIS preserves as much as possible of the text after the last backslash.

trans-unit.source: The string is not modified unless the $DT_MODIFYSTRING flag is specified

seg-source.mrk: The string is not modified unless the $DT_MODIFYSTRING flag is specified

target.mrk: The string is not modified unless the $DT_MODIFYSTRING flag is specified

trans-unit.source: $DT_PREFIXONLY - Draws only an underline at the position of the character following the ampersand (&) prefix character.

seg-source.mrk: $DT_PREFIXONLY - Draws only an underline at the position of the character following the ampersand (&) prefix character.

target.mrk: $DT_PREFIXONLY - Draws only an underline at the position of the character following the ampersand (&) prefix character.

trans-unit.source: Does not draw any other characters in the string

seg-source.mrk: Does not draw any other characters in the string

target.mrk: Does not draw any other characters in the string

trans-unit.source: $DT_RIGHT - Aligns text to the right

seg-source.mrk: $DT_RIGHT - Aligns text to the right

target.mrk: $DT_RIGHT - Aligns text to the right

trans-unit.source: $DT_RTLREADING - Layout in right to left reading order for bi-directional text

seg-source.mrk: $DT_RTLREADING - Layout in right to left reading order for bi-directional text

target.mrk: $DT_RTLREADING - Layout in right to left reading order for bi-directional text

trans-unit.source: $DT_SINGLELINE - Displays text on a single line only

seg-source.mrk: $DT_SINGLELINE - Displays text on a single line only

target.mrk: $DT_SINGLELINE - Displays text on a single line only

trans-unit.source: $DT_TABSTOP - Sets tab stops. Bits 15-8 of $iFlags specify the number of characters for each tab

seg-source.mrk: $DT_TABSTOP - Sets tab stops.
Bits 15-8 of $iFlags specify the number of characters for each tab

target.mrk: $DT_TABSTOP - Sets tab stops.
Bits 15-8 of $iFlags specify the number of characters for each tab

trans-unit.source: $DT_TOP - Top-justifies text (single line only)

seg-source.mrk: $DT_TOP - Top-justifies text (single line only)

target.mrk: $DT_TOP - Top-justifies text (single line only)

trans-unit.source: $DT_VCENTER - Centers text vertically (single line only)

seg-source.mrk: $DT_VCENTER - Centers text vertically (single line only)

target.mrk: $DT_VCENTER - Centers text vertically (single line only)

trans-unit.source: $DT_WORDBREAK - Breaks words

seg-source.mrk: $DT_WORDBREAK - Breaks words

target.mrk: $DT_WORDBREAK - Breaks words

trans-unit.source: $DT_WORD_ELLIPSIS - Truncates any word that does not fit in the rectangle and adds ellipses

seg-source.mrk: $DT_WORD_ELLIPSIS - Truncates any word that does not fit in the rectangle and adds ellipses

target.mrk: $DT_WORD_ELLIPSIS - Truncates any word that does not fit in the rectangle and adds ellipses

seg-source.mrk: Return Value

target.mrk: Return Value

trans-unit.source: The height of the text

seg-source.mrk: The height of the text

target.mrk: The height of the text

trans-unit.source: Remarks

seg-source.mrk: Remarks

target.mrk: Remarks

trans-unit.source: The DrawText function uses the device context's selected font, text color, and background color to draw the text.

seg-source.mrk: The DrawText function uses the device context's selected font, text color, and background color to draw the text.

target.mrk: The DrawText function uses the device context's selected font, text color, and background color to draw the text.

trans-unit.source: Unless the $DT_NOCLIP format is used, DrawText clips the text so that it does not appear outside the specified rectangle.

seg-source.mrk: Unless the $DT_NOCLIP format is used, DrawText clips the text so that it does not appear outside the specified rectangle.

target.mrk: Unless the $DT_NOCLIP format is used, DrawText clips the text so that it does not appear outside the specified rectangle.

trans-unit.source: All formatting is assumed to have multiple lines unless the $DT_SINGLELINE format is specified.

seg-source.mrk: All formatting is assumed to have multiple lines unless the $DT_SINGLELINE format is specified.

target.mrk: All formatting is assumed to have multiple lines unless the $DT_SINGLELINE format is specified.

trans-unit.source: If the selected font is too large, DrawText does not attempt to substitute a smaller font.

seg-source.mrk: If the selected font is too large, DrawText does not attempt to substitute a smaller font.

target.mrk: If the selected font is too large, DrawText does not attempt to substitute a smaller font.

trans-unit.source: Above constants require #include <WindowsConstants.au3>

seg-source.mrk: Above constants require #include <WindowsConstants.au3>

target.mrk: Above constants require #include <WindowsConstants.au3>
